div.p: J.L.Dodds
Co L 23 Engr
American Ex Force
Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson Tennesse
U.S.A.
June 25 1918
Some where in France
Dear Ellen
Well will try to write you a few lines this evening. I am feeling fine and hope you are the same. I sure would like to here from you but cant.
I dont think it is your fault but we cant get any mail now I know the reason but guess I cant tell you
I think things will soon be alright again and then I will have to have a day off to read my mail when it comes It has been about three weeks sence we got mail
I am working real hard I am driving a big army truck and we have some pretty bad roads to drive over so it not as easy as one would think
I have give up the idea of being a cook. I was afraid some one would want me to cook when I came back home and I wouldnt do that at all I like the truck much better
than I did the cooking. I am moving around all the time seeing different things and that is what I like I dont want to spend all my money in one place.
But we get in some places that don't look so good I have been up pretty close to the Germans front line trenches a couple of times they have aeroplanes and balloons up
and all they would have to do is to tell the German Art. where we were and off goes my head. Oh well I might get by if I was lucky.
We have a Y.M.C.A. here where we are now and ever night we have some thing doing there is going to be a show to night so I will have to get through with this letter in time to see it
but I have lots of time yet Jno Cortmell is sitting here writing thank he is writing to his girl
He will write a few lines and then laugh I guess he is tell her just how it happened Well I dont blame him do you?
Well what is going on in Jaxon? Sure would like to be there this evening as it is about 12 oclock there now and I have done had my supper So you can see I am ahead of you
Well I had a funny dream last night I dreamed I got married Now who do you thank the unlucky one was just tell you It was Clara Fox now isnt that funny how a fellow will have such foolish dreams
But I was awful dissatisfid I had not married the right girl well I wont tell you who the right one was, and at last I jumped about half out of my bed and there wasnt any of it true.

Well I have told you about all there is to tell so guess I will quit for this time hope I will soon get my mail and will be a dozen or more letters from you write me real soon and tell me all the news.
As Ever
James L Dodds
Co L 23 Engr
American Ex Force
Via N.Y. France
